text: [Music]
AWS allows us to scale the levels that
we would never be able to do on our
[Music]
own I'm Scott Bard CTO and founder of
thism moment.com this moment has offices
in six locations across the globe we're
130 employees and we service companies
such as Coca-Cola AT&T Sony Pictures and
IBM we use the AWS Cloud to power Brands
such as Coca-Cola to have a consistent
message across YouTube Facebook a brand
site as well as taking that message in
those locations and powering on to
mobile phones and tablets this moment
uses AWS Cloud for elb to ec2 to RDS we
host all of the client assets on S3 and
distribute them globally using
cloudfront we use S3 to store of the
client media assets and we have about 20
terab of storage we use cloudfront to
distribute the client's media assets all
over the globe and allows us to have
very low latency on photos and videos
anywhere in the world we use RDS as
single tendency to keep all the client
data segregated as well as that allow us
to scale each campaign individually on
any given day we use between 500 to 600
ec2 instances we use Auto Auto scaling
extensively so servers are coming up and
down all day long depending on client's
needs we love reserved instances because
it allows us to control cost by buying
in bulk our E2 instances and our RDS
instances we use cloudwatch to monitor
everything we monitor our ec2 RDS and
elastic cach instances and if any
thresholds are crossed we get an SNS
notification when then it will escalate
the email and then it will escalate to
our Pages if necessary during Super Bowl
Sunday AWS set up a war room right next
to our war room so we're able to manage
all of our instances at the end of Super
Bowl commercials you'll see a URL those
URLs were pointing to us from 20
different Super Bowl ads we were able to
scale up hundreds and hundreds of ec2
instances and then scale them right back
down after the Super Bowl so costs were
kept to a minimal and all of the
campaigns worked flawlessly instead of
engineering worrying about how to scale
and bring up servers and bring them down
and controlling cost we have Engineers
working on things like responsive design
in mobile applications and figuring out
all the ways to publish into YouTube and
Facebook we love working with AWS from
the account managers to the solution
Architects to the support staff it is
like having a huge sis admin team right
on our own team
[Music]
